translation.en: Emily!
You're the medical examiner?
Mr. Rose?
I'm sorry, Mr. Rose...
...but I cannot state conclusively...
...that the cause of death was natural.
Your daughter, she....
Excuse me, Father?
Father Moore.
You'll have to come with me.
-Father Moore! -Will you plead guilty?
-Tell us about the exorcism! -Over here, Father Moore!
translation.ko: - 엑소시즘에 대해 한 말씀만! - 이쪽 좀 봐 주세요!

translation.en: We're at Crescent County Courthouse. We show you Father Richard Moore....
translation.ko: 이곳은 법원 청사 앞인데요 보시다시피 무어 신부가...

translation.en: -What about the parents? -They're not talking to the police.
translation.ko: - 부모는 뭐래요? - 경찰한테 말 안 해요

translation.en: Do we charge them?
No. Even the priest admits he ran the show.
We need a Christian on this.
Preferably a Catholic.
Somebody that knows this shit inside out...
...and who the public will see as unbiased.
We're going after a holy man here.
Ethan Thomas.
He's not Catholic, though. Methodist, I think.
But the guy practically lives at church. Choir, teaches Sunday school.
translation.ko: 교회에서 살다시피 하고 성가대에 주일 학교 교사예요

translation.en: He's no choirboy in the courtroom. I've seen him tear people up.
translation.ko: 법정에서는 딴 사람으로 인정사정 안 봐주고

translation.en: He's a shrewd son of a bitch.
All right, pull him off whatever he's doing. He's lead prosecutor.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 어떻게든 데려와요 그가 수석 검사요

translation.en: There's ambition. She never stops. She even works while she drinks.
translation.ko: 야망이 있고, 포기를 모르죠 술자리에서도 일한다니까요

translation.en: -Gentlemen, you know Erin Bruner. -Of course.
-Hello. -I was so sure Van Hopper would fry...
...but you proved me wrong, lady.
The system worked, that's all.
Gentlemen, you'll excuse us, will you?
Have you seen the news about this priest?
I heard something about an exorcism gone bad, but I don't know the details.
The DA charged him with negligent homicide.
They offered a very reasonable plea bargain, but the priest turned it down.
translation.ko: 꽤 합당한 양형 거래를 제안했는데 그가 거절했어 안 돼요 저한테 맡길 생각 마세요

translation.en: Do not ask me to take this--
translation.ko: 안 돼요 저한테 맡길 생각 마세요

translation.en: The archdiocese specifically requested you.
-Why me? -They followed the Van Hopper trial.
translation.ko: - 왜 저를요? - 밴 호퍼 공판을 지켜봤을 테니

translation.en: They think you're smart...
...and convincing.
They want you to ask the priest to reconsider.
translation.ko: 신부가 마음을 바꾸게 설득해 주기를 바라네

translation.en: Well, what if he won't?
This sounds like a quagmire. If I'm smart, I'll leave it alone.
translation.ko: 수렁에 빠질 게 뻔한데 현명하다면 개입 안 해야죠

translation.en: Erin, the Van Hopper case got you back on the fast track.
translation.ko: 에린, 밴 호퍼 사건으로 앞길이 탄탄대로잖아

translation.en: Once again, you're a rising star.
-Chivas, neat, please. -Tanqueray martini, dry.
-What are you saying? -I'm saying, you do this for me...
...and the rising star keeps rising.
The case is yours.
And just how high do I get to rise this time?
I've been junior partner for too long now, Karl.
-It's not like other firms haven't called. -Erin--
I want my name on the door, right next to yours.
translation.ko: 내 이름을 올려줘요 당신 이름 바로 옆에!

translation.en: Okay.
Try to get the deal.
If the priest won't and this goes to trial...
...the archdiocese feels he could be an embarrassment.
So under no circumstances is he to testify.
translation.ko: 그러니까 절대 증언대에 세워서는 안 돼

translation.en: No, of course. If I'd put Van Hopper on the stand...
...he'd be marking time on death row instead of sunbathing in Miami.
translation.ko: 마이애미 해변에서 일광욕 대신 사형 날짜나 세고 있었겠죠

translation.en: His tab.
Good morning, I'm Erin Bruner.
May I sit down?
They brought the chair for my public defender.
translation.ko: 내 국선 변호사가 앉을 의자일 텐데

translation.en: I guess they left it when they decided I wasn't going to kill myself with it.
translation.ko: 내가 자살할 것 같지는 않으니 그냥 놔둔 모양이오

translation.en: My firm represents the archdiocese.
Yes.
Yes, I was expecting them to send someone.
translation.ko: 누군가 보낼 거라 예상은 하고 있었소

translation.en: -Why did they choose you? -I wanted this case.
-So you like the spotlight? -I'm used to it.
I defended James Van Hopper.
And now you've come to further your celebrity.
No.
I'm here to make senior partner at my firm.
-Are you a Catholic? -No.
I'm an agnostic, I guess. I'm not really sure.
If you're not sure, then you are one.
I don't think you're the right attorney. I'll stick with my public defender.
translation.ko: 미안하지만, 당신은 아닌 것 같소 그냥 내 국선 변호사로 하겠소

translation.en: He can't get the DA to get you a better deal. I can.
translation.ko: 검찰을 상대하는 건 제가 더 나을 텐데요

translation.en: I won't be making any plea agreement.
If you don't, the archdiocese won't post your bail.
You'll be stuck in here for the trial.
Do you understand how long they can put you away?
It's been explained to me.
The DA's office doesn't like it when religion holds itself above the law.
translation.ko: 검찰은 종교가 법 위에 있다는 논리를 원하지 않아요

translation.en: And this prosecutor, Ethan Thomas?
You're gonna need somebody hungry and smart...
...and aggressive to even have a chance.
What would your strategy be to defend me against such a formidable man?
translation.ko: 그런 막강한 자를 상대로 날 변호할 전략이 뭐죠?

translation.en: -That depends. -On what?
On how you wanna be defended.
What's your main concern, other than staying out of jail?
translation.ko: 석방되는 것 말고 가장 신경 쓰시는 게 뭐죠?

translation.en: -Is it how you're being portrayed? -I don't care about my reputation.
translation.ko: - 이미지 관리라든지? - 명성 따위는 관심 없소

translation.en: I'm not afraid of jail.
What I care about is telling Emily Rose's story.
translation.ko: 내가 신경 쓰는 건 에밀리의 이야기요

translation.en: I want people to hear what only I can tell.
translation.ko: 나만 할 수 있는 그 이야기를 들어주길 바라오

translation.en: And what is that?
What really happened to Emily...
...and why.
If I let you defend me...
...will you promise to let me testify and tell the truth about what happened?
translation.ko: 증언을 하고 진실을 말하게 해 주겠다고 약속해 주겠소?

translation.en: And what is the truth you would tell? That the ritual killed her?
translation.ko: 무슨 진실을 말씀하신다는 거죠? 종교의식으로 죽은 거라고요?

translation.en: -Was it your fault she died? -No.
All right. Then I'll let you tell her story.
But only if you agree to let me do whatever else it takes to win.
translation.ko: 대신 승소를 위해 뭐든 해도 된다고 하시면요

translation.en: You're not used to this kind of place.
I'm sure our life is very strange to you.
Not so strange.
I grew up in a little town.
But our house wasn't as nice or as big as this.
translation.ko: 우리 집은 이만큼 크고 좋지도 않았고요

translation.en: My mother, she raised me alone.
She was a schoolteacher, so we had very little money.
What a wonderful thing to be.
That was Emily's dream, to be a teacher.
translation.ko: 그게 에밀리 꿈이었는데 선생님이 되는 거요

translation.en: That's why she went away to the university.
A lot of cats live here.
There are...
...11 now, I think.
Emily always brought them home.
Ever since she was a little girl, she couldn't leave a stray abandoned.
translation.ko: 어릴 때부터 버려진 녀석들을 그냥 지나치지 못하고

translation.en: Before these troubles began...
...was Emily a happy girl?
Oh, yes.
Before she went away to university...
...my Emily was so very happy.
What is going on--? Girls!
Mama.
Is it--?
It's a scholarship, Mama.
They pay for it. They pay for everything.
This is your dream, Emily.
You'll be leaving us.
It's okay.
I'll be okay.
I'm gonna show this to your father.
-Counselor. Thanks for meeting me. -Sure.
translation.ko: - 변호사님, 와 주셔서 감사합니다 - 당연히 와야죠

translation.en: Can I buy you a drink, Mr. Thomas? He makes an excellent martini.
translation.ko: 제가 한잔 살까요? 검사님 여기 마티니가 끝내주는데

translation.en: Just water for me, please.
So...
...the judge thinks we should offer a new plea agreement.
translation.ko: 재판장님이 양형 합의를 다시 하라고 하시더군요

translation.en: She feels the community might be better served without this trial.
translation.ko: 이런 공판은 지역 사회에 좋지 않다고 보시는 거죠

translation.en: How do you feel about it?
Personally.
My job is to represent the interests of the people...
...and make an effort to be objective.
I ask because I know you're a churchgoer.
Now you're set to prosecute a man of God.
Your priest broke the law...
...and a young girl is dead.
If he's a man of God, then, personally, I think he's even more subject...
translation.ko: 성직자라면 도덕적 행위에 있어 더 모범적이어야 하고

translation.en: ...to the laws of moral behavior. If it were up to me, he'd get no deal.
translation.ko: 처벌에도 더 엄격해야죠 저라면 합의는 어림없어요

translation.en: And forgiveness and compassion? Isn't that part of your creed?
Or does that just get in the way of your work?
If you have compassion for your client...
...you'll persuade him to accept this:
Charges reduced to reckless endangerment.
Twelve months in a county jail.
Reducible to six, plus probation, if he stays out of trouble.
Somehow I expect he can manage that.
translation.ko: 그 정도는 감당할 수 있을 테니

translation.en: But please understand me. If he refuses, I will seek the maximum.
Father Moore has made it clear there will be no plea agreement.
translation.ko: 신부님 입장은 확고해요 양형 합의는 없을 거래요

translation.en: He will not lie or admit to something he is not guilty of.
translation.ko: 거짓말하거나 유죄라는 건 인정할 수 없고

translation.en: -And he was never neglectful of Emily. -"Never neglectful"?
translation.ko: - 과실 치사는 절대 아니래요 - 절대 아니라고요?

translation.en: Have you seen the postmortem photographs?
We'll go to trial. My client wants the public to know the truth.
translation.ko: 재판까지 가 보죠, 제 의뢰인은 진실을 알리고 싶어 해요

translation.en: Good.
So do I.
Have a good night, counselor.
Let the record show that the defendant and his counsel are present...
...and that the jury is seated.
-Mr. Thomas, you may begin. -Thank you, Your Honor.
Good morning, ladies and gentlemen. My name is Ethan Thomas.
I'm the assistant district attorney, and I represent the people.
In the case before you, the evidence will show...
...that the victim had a serious medical condition that demanded treatment.
translation.ko: 희생자는 의학적 치료가 필요한 심각한 병을 앓고 있었습니다

translation.en: We will prove that the victim's condition rendered her physically...
...and psychologically incapable of caring for herself.
translation.ko: 정신적으로 자신을 통제할 수 없는 상태였죠

translation.en: Her care...
...was then wholly entrusted...
...to that man, the defendant, Father Richard Moore.
translation.ko: 저기 피고인 리처드 무어 신부에게 말이죠

translation.en: She became his responsibility...
...and he betrayed that responsibility...
...by persuading her to abandon her medical treatment...
...in favor of religious treatment:
A ritual exorcism, performed by the defendant...
...allegedly to cure the victim by ridding her of demonic forces.
We will demonstrate that this course of action...
...directly resulted in the victim's death.
I said a moment ago that I represent the people.
We all know what that means, but it's a little abstract, isn't it?
translation.ko: 그 말뜻을 아시겠지만 다소 추상적이기는 하죠

translation.en: Miss Bruner, the attorney for the defense...
...is seated right next to the man she represents.
And I stand here to represent the people.
translation.ko: 저는 민중을 대변하고자 이 자리에 서 있지만

translation.en: That's not really why I stand here today.
I'm here on behalf of someone who can't sit at a table...
translation.ko: 제가 대변하려는 이는 이 자리에 앉아 있을 수 없고

translation.en: ...and look at you every day and gain your sympathy...
translation.ko: 매일 여러분을 직접 보며 동정을 받을 수 없고

translation.en: ...someone who can't take the stand to testify...
...and tell you what happened in her own words.
translation.ko: 자신에게 일어난 일을 직접 말할 수도 없습니다

translation.en: A young girl...
...that could've been your daughter.
Could've been mine.
A girl who trusted Father Richard Moore with her life.
translation.ko: 리처드 무어 신부를 믿고 인생을 걸었던 소녀는

translation.en: This is what she looked like...
...before the defendant began his religious treatment.
translation.ko: 피고가 종교적 처치를 하기 전의 모습이죠

translation.en: This is a photograph taken of her on the day that she died.
I stand here for Emily Rose...
translation.ko: 저는 에밀리를 위해 이 자리에 섰습니다

translation.en: ...who died horribly...
...at age 19.
You won't be able to see Emily sitting here day after day during this trial.
translation.ko: 이 재판 중에 늘 이곳에서 에밀리 양을 볼 수는 없지만

translation.en: But I hope you'll remember her as she was when she was alive...
translation.ko: 생전의 그 모습을 기억해 주셨으면 합니다

translation.en: ...and full of...
...hopes and dreams.
And as she was when Father Richard Moore was finished with her...
translation.ko: 리처드 무어 신부로 인해 생을 끝내고

translation.en: ...and left her to die.
Thank you.
Is the defense prepared to make its opening statement?
I'd like to reserve my opening statement...
...until the presentation of the defense's case.
As is your privilege.
Prosecution may begin.
That was already my plan.
Thank you, Your Honor. The people call Dr. Edith Vogel.
I've known Emily her entire life. I took care of all of the Rose girls.
translation.ko: 에밀리는 제가 잘 알아요 그 집 딸들을 다 돌봤거든요

translation.en: Can you describe Emily as you knew her growing up?
She was a bit sickly in her early years.
She stayed inside a lot, reading, learning music.
translation.ko: 거의 방에서 책을 읽고 음악을 공부했죠

translation.en: How did she feel about going to school?
translation.ko: 대학 진학 때 심리 상태는 어땠나요?

translation.en: Objection. The witness is not a psychiatrist.
translation.ko: 이의 있습니다 증인은 정신과 의사가 아닙니다

translation.en: I'll rephrase. Did you talk to Emily about going off to college?
translation.ko: 정정합니다, 대학 진학에 대해 대화를 나누셨나요?

translation.en: Yes. She told me she was excited...
...but nervous that she would be away from her family in the big city.
translation.ko: 가족을 떠나 대도시로 가는 게 불안하다고도 했지만요

translation.en: This was an overwhelming change for her.
Did you stay in touch after she went away?
Yes. She wrote me a letter saying that she'd been to a dance...
translation.ko: 네, 편지를 보냈는데 춤추러 갔었다고 했어요

translation.en: ...and she'd met a boy named Jason.
She didn't want her mother to know this...
...because her mother did not approve of dancing...
translation.ko: 엄마가 춤추는 건 허락하지 않을 거라고요

translation.en: ...and had warned her about the boys at school.
Did Emily communicate with you again last fall after you received the letter?
translation.ko: 그 편지를 받고 나서 에밀리가 지난가을에도 연락했나요?

translation.en: Actually, it was her mother.
She telephoned me...
...waking me out of a deep sleep at 4 in the morning.
She asked me to call Emily at a payphone on the university campus.
translation.ko: 캠퍼스에 공중전화가 있으니 에밀리한테 전화해 보라고요

translation.en: When Emily answered, she was quite hysterical.
translation.ko: 에밀리가 전화를 받았는데 감정이 격해 있었어요

translation.en: At first, she just sobbed uncontrollably.
translation.ko: 주체할 수 없이 계속 흐느껴 울었죠

translation.en: But eventually she calmed down enough to tell me what happened.
translation.ko: 좀 진정하고 나서야 무슨 일인지 말해 줬어요

translation.en: She said that she was alone that weekend.
Her roommate had gone home.
She had awakened...
...and thought she smelled something burning.
There was no alarm, but she got up...
...afraid there was a fire.
Dr. Mueller, what's your position at the university hospital?
translation.ko: 뮐러 박사님, 대학 병원에서 어떤 직책을 맡고 계시죠?

translation.en: I am chairman of the Department of Neurology.
And after you heard about the dorm-room incident...
...what were your initial thoughts?
At first, I thought perhaps Emily had taken illegal drugs.
translation.ko: 처음에 에밀리가 불법 약물을 복용했다고 생각했습니다

translation.en: Some type of hallucinogen.
But we ran tests and found no trace of drugs in her system.
translation.ko: 하지만 검사 결과 그런 흔적은 없었습니다

translation.en: And the more she explained the incident to me...
...the more I began to suspect something else.
Epilepsy results from uncontrolled electrical activity in the brain.
translation.ko: 간질은 뇌에 발작적인 전기적 활성으로 발생하는데

translation.en: In a severe, or grand mal, seizure...
...a person may lose consciousness for several minutes...
...and suffer involuntary contractions of all the muscles of the body.
translation.ko: 온몸 근육의 비자발적 수축으로 극심한 고통을 겪습니다

translation.en: Is it possible for a person suffering such a seizure...
...to have hallucinations or perceive the things that Emily described?
translation.ko: 에밀리가 말한 환각 증세가 나타날 수 있습니까?

translation.en: The muscle contractions could feel like an extreme pressure on the body.
translation.ko: 근육 수축은 몸에 심한 압박을 가할 수 있죠

translation.en: And it is certainly possible, with all that brain activity...
...for a person to perceive all sorts of strange and violent things.
translation.ko: 뭔가 이상하고 폭력적인 것을 인지할 가능성이 있습니다

translation.en: So suspecting that Emily was epileptic, how did you proceed?
translation.ko: 에밀리가 간질일 것 같았을 때 어떤 조처를 하셨죠?

translation.en: I administered an electroencephalograph.
What did the EEG reveal?
It showed a possible epileptic focus in the patient's left temporal lobe.
Did this require a specific treatment?
Yes, I began a medication schedule for Emily with the drug Gambutrol.
translation.ko: 네, 감부트롤을 처방하고 약물치료 일정을 잡았습니다

translation.en: I also advised regular follow-up examinations and further tests.
translation.ko: 정기적인 추적 조사와 추가 검사도 권했지만

translation.en: But Emily failed to keep her follow-up appointments with me.
She give any reason for discontinuing these appointments?
translation.ko: 약속을 안 지킨 이유를 말해 줬나요?

translation.en: Yes, she told me she was convinced that her condition was a spiritual one.
translation.ko: 네, 자신의 병은 영적인 것이라고 확신한다고 했어요

translation.en: It was the conviction of her priest, she said, and she shared his beliefs.
translation.ko: 신부님도 그렇게 확신했다며 그 말을 굳게 믿었죠

translation.en: Was it your impression that Emily had placed her care...
translation.ko: 그럼 에밀리가 제대로 치료를 받았다면 완치될...

translation.en: -...entirely--? -Leading the witness.
Sustained.
After the end of October...
...did you ask Emily why she had stopped...
translation.ko: 에밀리가 왜 약 처방 받는 것을

translation.en: ...filling her Gambutrol prescriptions?
Yes. She said that Father Moore had suggested she stop taking the drug.
translation.ko: 네, 무어 신부님이 약 복용을 중단하라고 제안했다고 했습니다

translation.en: And what, in your medical opinion...
...was the result of Father Moore's suggestion?
translation.ko: 그 제안은 어떤 결과를 초래할 수 있죠?

translation.en: I believe Father Moore's suggestion killed her.
Objection, Your Honor!
The witness is asserting outrageous conclusions based on pure hearsay.
translation.ko: 증인은 불확실한 사실에 근거해 부당한 결론을 내리고 있습니다

translation.en: Technically correct, but I'll allow it as part of his expert opinion testimony.
Thank you, Dr. Mueller.
Your witness.
You said you observed a possible epileptic focus in the temporal lobe.
Doesn't this imply what you observed may not have been an epileptic focus?
translation.ko: 그것이 간질이 아닐 가능성도 있다는 말씀 아닌가요?

translation.en: Yes, that's also possible.
Would Father Moore's advice to stop taking Gambutrol be good advice...
translation.ko: 그렇다면 약을 끊으라는 조언이 바람직했을 수도 있었겠군요

translation.en: ...if Emily were, in fact, not epileptic?
Of course. But that's not the case here. She was epileptic.
Really.
When Emily saw objects move on their own...
translation.ko: 에밀리가 물체들이 저절로 움직이는 걸 보고

translation.en: ...and felt an invisible presence on top of her...
translation.ko: 머리 위에 보이지 않는 존재를 느꼈듯이

translation.en: ...was she experiencing symptoms typical of epilepsy?
Not typical, no.
Are they typical indications of any other conditions?
translation.ko: 그럼 다른 질환의 징후일 수도 있겠군요

translation.en: -Say, for example, psychosis? -Yes, I would say that's correct.
translation.ko: - 정신질환 같은 것요 - 네, 그럴 수 있습니다

translation.en: But isn't psychosis an entirely different medical condition from epilepsy?
translation.ko: 하지만 정신질환은 간질과는 전혀 다른 병이 아닌가요?

translation.en: -Yes, in my-- -So aren't you selectively choosing...
translation.ko: - 네, 그렇기는 하지만... - 그럼 박사님께서는 일부러

translation.en: ...what parts of Emily's experiences fit your epilepsy diagnosis...
translation.ko: 에밀리의 증상에서 간질 진단에 해당하는 것만 끼워 맞추고

translation.en: ...while ignoring those which indicate something else?
-Objection. Argumentative. -Withdrawn.
No further questions.
We have to work fast.
They're only giving me an hour with you tonight.
Listen.
Before we get started, there's something I have to tell you...
translation.ko: 시작하기 전에 말해 둘 게 있소

translation.en: ...something I should've said to you before I let you take the case.
translation.ko: 변호를 맡기기 전에 말해야 했던 거요

translation.en: Okay.
There are forces surrounding this trial.
translation.ko: 이 재판을 둘러싼 어떤 기운이 느껴져요

translation.en: Dark, powerful forces.
Just be careful, Erin. Watch your step.
I see.
Look--
Father, you don't have to worry about me.
I'm an agnostic, remember?
Demons exist, whether you believe in them or not.
Your involvement in this trial might just open you up to their attacks.
translation.ko: 이런 재판에 개입하는 자체로 그 공격에 노출될 수 있어요

translation.en: Look, Father, I appreciate your concern...
...but you need to be worried about yourself.
Ethan Thomas is using the medical aspects of this case as ammunition...
translation.ko: 검사가 의학적 증거를 무기로 내세우고 있어요

translation.en: ...and I have to be prepared for his attacks, so...
...with what little time we have, I think we need to focus on your defense.
translation.ko: 시간이 거의 없으니 신부님 변론에 주력해야 해요

translation.en: Now, what I need from you is more information about Emily's condition.
translation.ko: 에밀리의 상태에 대해 더 자세히 알려주세요

translation.en: Specific details of how it progressed after the dorm-room episode.
translation.ko: 기숙사 사건 후에 상황을 구체적으로 자세하게요

translation.en: Well, after the first incident...
...she was sent to the university hospital for testing and observation.
translation.ko: 검사와 보호 관찰을 위해 대학 병원에 입원했어요

translation.en: Emily once told me that in her dorm room, she resisted the demons...
...but at the hospital they overcame her.
So she believed...
...that her possession began at the hospital?
Yeah, I think she did.
And after that, things just went from bad to worse.
Emily!
Emily?
Oh, my God. Emily?
Don't touch me.
Jason, please...
...don't leave me.
And I never did leave her.
I stayed until the end.
So much of what we shared was like a nightmare...
translation.ko: 함께했던 많은 순간이 정말 악몽 같았지만

translation.en: ...but I wouldn't give up a single minute I spent with her.
She woke me up, you know?
To things I never felt before, things I never knew I could feel.
translation.ko: 전에 느끼지 못했던 많은 것을 깨닫게 해 줬어요

translation.en: I never knew how dead I was until I met her.
translation.ko: 그전까지는 살아 있어도 사는 게 아니었어요

translation.en: --residential north metro district where James Van Hopper...
translation.ko: 북부의 한 주거 지역에 사는 밴 호퍼는

translation.en: ...acquitted after a controversial trial...
translation.ko: 논란이 됐던 공판에서 무죄 판결을 받았는데요

translation.en: -Can you turn that up, please? -...has apparently struck again.
translation.ko: - 소리 좀 크게 해 주실래요? - 또다시 체포됐습니다

translation.en: It was inside this quiet suburban home...
...that police say James Van Hopper murdered a young couple today.
translation.ko: 제임스 밴 호퍼가 오늘 한 젊은 부부를 살해했습니다

translation.en: Sources close to the investigation say that Van Hopper...
translation.ko: 수사 당국의 소식통에 따르면 밴 호퍼는

translation.en: ...who was acquitted of murder charges in April...
translation.ko: 작년 4월, 살인 혐의에 무죄 판결을 받았던 자로

translation.en: ...may have known both of the victims.
Their names are being withheld pending family notification.
translation.ko: 희생자들 이름은 가족 확인 후 공개될 것입니다

translation.en: Most glorious prince of the heavenly army...
...holy Michael, the archangel...
...defend us in battle against the princes...
...powers and rulers of darkness.
Counsel Bruner, my courtroom day begins at 9:30 a.m.
-I'm sorry, Your Honor, I-- -Which was 17 minutes ago.
Ready to proceed?
Yes, Your Honor.
Dr. Briggs, please state your qualifications for the court.
I have advanced degrees in medicine...
...psychiatry and neurology from Johns Hopkins...
translation.ko: 정신 의학과 신경학에 박사 학위를 받았고

translation.en: ...and I have had three books and several dozen papers published...
translation.ko: 세 권의 책을 집필하고 다수의 논문을 발표했습니다

translation.en: ...in the fields of neurology and neuropsychiatry.
What was the cause of death, as determined by the autopsy?
The decedent expired due to a gradual shutdown of the bodily functions.
translation.ko: 생체 기능의 점진적인 정지로 사망에 이른 것입니다

translation.en: Why did her body shut down?
The autopsy found that it was a cumulative effect...
...from numerous physical traumas exacerbated by malnutrition...
translation.ko: 수많은 신체적 외상이 영양실조로 인해 악화하고

translation.en: ...which severely inhibited her ability to recuperate from those traumas.
translation.ko: 결국 그런 외상성 장애에서 건강을 회복하지 못했던 것이죠

translation.en: In other words, her starving body had little or no means to recover...
translation.ko: 다시 말해, 굶주린 상태에서 상처를 치유할 회복 능력이

translation.en: ...from the injuries it was sustaining, and so it eventually just gave out.
translation.ko: 제 기능을 하지 못해 결국 사망한 것입니다

translation.en: How did Emily get these injuries?
Some were the result of violent epileptic seizures...
translation.ko: 일부는 격렬한 간질 발작에 의한 것이었고

translation.en: ...and some were self-inflicted.
And why, in your opinion, did Emily injure herself...
translation.ko: 그렇다면 박사님 생각에 에밀리가 왜 자해하고

translation.en: ...and why did she stop eating?
Upon review of her complete medical file...
translation.ko: 의료 기록을 모두 검토해 본 결과

translation.en: ...I concluded that Emily's epilepsy had evolved...
...into a condition known as psychotic epileptic disorder.
translation.ko: 정신병적 간질 장애로 악화하였던 것 같습니다

translation.en: This is a rare development, to be sure...
...but one that I have witnessed numerous times.
translation.ko: 저도 여러 차례 본 적은 있습니다

translation.en: -Emily was epileptic and psychotic? -Yes.
Explain how this psychotic epileptic disorder would manifest itself.
translation.ko: 정신병적 간질 장애는 어떻게 발현되는지 설명해 주시죠

translation.en: The seizures would have the symptoms of schizophrenia...
...such as auditory and visual hallucinations...
...and sometimes extreme paranoia.
The seizures may lock up the joints and slightly contort the body.
translation.ko: 발작으로 관절이 뻣뻣해지고 몸이 뒤틀리기도 하고

translation.en: The pupils will dilate, making the eyes appear black.
So you believe that Emily had epilepsy...
...which developed into a form of violent psychosis...
...a condition that can be controlled with Gambutrol?
Yes. And it would've been, if she'd continued her treatment.
In your opinion, if Emily had continued with her medication...
-...would she be alive today? -Absolutely.
If treated early, psychotic epileptic disorder is rarely fatal.
translation.ko: 조기 치료 시 정신병적 간질은 결코 치명적이지 않습니다

translation.en: I mean, this--
This was a very sick girl.
The defendant should've realized that Emily was in need...
translation.ko: 피고가 에밀리에게 지속적인 치료가 필요하다는 것을

translation.en: ...of continued medical treatment.
Thank you, doctor. Your witness.
Doctor, you testified that Gambutrol could've controlled Emily's condition.

translation.en: How do you know that?
It's the inevitable result of taking the drug.
translation.ko: 그 약물 복용에 따른 당연한 결과니까요

translation.en: It would've controlled her seizures...
...which were the root cause of her psychosis.
But wasn't Emily still experiencing psychotic symptoms...
translation.ko: 하지만 에밀리의 정신병적 증상은 계속되지 않았나요?

translation.en: ...even after she started taking the medication?
Yes. Because Gambutrol has a cumulative effect.
It takes time to build up in the system.
You assume that Gambutrol would've helped her, but you don't know.
translation.ko: 감부트롤의 효과를 추측하실 뿐 정확히 아는 것은 아니시군요

translation.en: It's a reasonable assumption, but....
No, of course, I can't be certain.
Doctor, is "psychotic epileptic disorder" a common medical term...
translation.ko: 정신병적 간질 장애가 일반적인 의학 용어인가요?

translation.en: ...or did you just make it up?
Well, I distinguished and named the--
translation.ko: 제가 편의상 구분 지어 그렇게 부르는...

translation.en: So psychotic epileptic disorder is really your own pet theory?
translation.ko: 그러니까 정신병적 간질 장애는 그저 박사님의 지론인 것이군요?

translation.en: -Objection. Argumentative. -Sustained.
When Emily chose to stop her medical treatment...
...what do you think should've been done?
Upon recognizing her condition...
...I would have tranquilized her and force-fed her.
And then, if necessary...
...I would've treated her with electroconvulsive therapy.
Electroshock treatment. You would've done this against her will?
translation.ko: 전기 충격 요법요? 에밀리가 원치 않았더라도요?

translation.en: To save her life?
Absolutely.
Nothing further.
The witness may step down.
Your Honor, I offer into evidence this photograph as People's Exhibit 3-A.
And having done so, the people rest.
The photograph is entered into evidence.
We are recessed until tomorrow morning, 9:30 sharp...
...at which time the defense will give its opening statement...
translation.ko: 그때 피고 측은 모두 진술을 진행하고

translation.en: ...and call its first witness.
I'm sorry I was late.
I didn't get a lot of sleep. Big power outage knocked out my alarm clock.
translation.ko: 잠을 잘 자지 못했는데 정전으로 알람까지 고장 났어요

translation.en: -It won't happen again. -No, I didn't sleep either.
translation.ko: - 이제 이런 일 없을 거예요 - 나도 잠을 못 잤소

translation.en: What kept you awake?
Doesn't matter.
You're under attack.
What are you talking about?
You're in a spiritual battle, Erin.
The forces of darkness are trying to keep you away from the light.
translation.ko: 어둠의 힘이 당신에게 가는 빛을 막으려 하고 있어요

translation.en: Don't let them.
Don't worry about today. We're doing fine.
translation.ko: 오늘 일은 걱정하지 마세요 잘하고 있으니까요

translation.en: We're getting creamed. I can't believe I walked right into that.
translation.ko: 우리가 당하고 있어 이렇게 말려들 줄 몰랐어

translation.en: Look, if we don't find a doctor to testify that Emily...
translation.ko: 유리한 증언을 해 줄 의사를 찾아야 해

translation.en: ...wasn't epileptic or schizophrenic or schizo-epileptic, we're gonna lose.
translation.ko: 간질이나 정신병이 아니었다고 안 그러면 진다고!

translation.en: Care of the city's main branch and the university library...
...I bring you another dozen fun-filled books...
...about the demonic and the mentally deranged.
They burned women at the stake...
...during witch hunts for being possessed.
Glad you don't have to defend those guys.
-How are we on our medical experts? -Not good.
translation.ko: - 우리 쪽 의학 전문가들은? - 소득 없어요

translation.en: The psychiatrist you wanted is tied up in another trial.
translation.ko: 원했던 정신과 의사는 다른 재판에 묶여있고

translation.en: And the neurologist is sailing to Costa Rica.
This book I'm reading, it's by an anthropologist.
translation.ko: 이 책은 한 인류학자가 쓴 것인데

translation.en: It's about contemporary cases of possession, mostly in the Third World.
translation.ko: 대부분 제삼 세계 국가들에 오늘날 빙의 사례에 관한 것이야

translation.en: People there are still primitive and superstitious.
translation.ko: 그곳 사람들은 아직도 미개하고 미신을 믿죠

translation.en: Maybe.
Maybe they see possession for what it really is.
translation.ko: 그들은 빙의를 있는 그대로 받아들일 수 있지

translation.en: Maybe we've taught ourselves not to see it.
translation.ko: 우리는 그것을 거부하라고 배웠을 수 있고

translation.en: -You saying you believe in this stuff? -No.
Maybe we shouldn't just try to invalidate the prosecution's case...
translation.ko: 검사 측 주장을 무효로 하는 것으로는 안 돼

translation.en: ...by punching holes in the medical approach.
Maybe we should also try to validate the alternative.
translation.ko: 대안을 찾아 입증해야 할 수도 있어

translation.en: -Validate possession in a court of law? -Yes.
Okay. I guess we could bring in some priests to talk about exorcisms--
translation.ko: 좋아요, 엑소시즘에 관해 얘기해 줄 신부들을 데려오죠

translation.en: No, the archdiocese won't let us do that.
They wanna limit the Church's exposure to Father Moore.
translation.ko: 교회의 노출은 무어 신부만으로 국한하기를 원해

translation.en: I've got three articles by the anthropologist who wrote this book.
translation.ko: 이 책에 인류학자가 쓴 세 개의 글이 있는데

translation.en: She approaches the subject of possession...
...from a scientific perspective and doesn't try to debunk it.
translation.ko: 과학적 관점으로 접근하고 부정하려고도 하지 않아

translation.en: -You want me to track her down? -Yeah.
Keep looking for a medical expert to refute Dr. Briggs.
translation.ko: 증언을 반박할 의료 전문가도 계속 찾아보고

translation.en: But send the case file to this Dr. Sadira Adani.
translation.ko: 사디라 아다니 박사에게 사건 파일을 보내드려

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury...
...as you know by now, my name is Erin Bruner...
...and I represent the defendant, Richard Moore.
translation.ko: 피고인 리처드 신부의 변호를 맡고 있습니다

translation.en: Mr. Thomas has contended that Emily Rose suffered...
...from a serious medical condition...
...that required medical treatment, nothing more.
He has asserted that any attempt by my client...
...to help Emily by anything other than medical means...
translation.ko: 에밀리를 돕기 위한 의학적 수단 외에 모든 노력이

translation.en: ...was not only inappropriate, but criminally negligent.
translation.ko: 부적절했을 뿐만 아니라 범죄적 과실이었다고 주장했죠
