...to what our evidence and testimony will show.
translation.ko: 저희가 제시할 증거와 증언에 귀 기울여 주시기 바랍니다

translation.en: Medical treatment was not the answer for Emily...
...because she simply did not suffer from a medical condition.
She was neither epileptic nor psychotic.
Emily Rose's condition, in fact, was demonic possession.
An exorcism was her only hope for a cure.
Some of you may find yourself unable to reconcile Emily's beliefs...
translation.ko: 에밀리의 믿음이나 피고의 신념을 받아들일 수 없다고

translation.en: ...or those of the defendant with your own.
You may not believe demons exist. You won't have to.
translation.ko: 악령의 존재를 믿지 않는다면 믿지 않으셔도 됩니다

translation.en: Because you will see that after the utter failure of doctors to help Emily...
translation.ko: 에밀리를 도우려는 의사의 노력이 완전히 실패로 돌아가자

translation.en: ...Father Moore simply tried to help Emily in a different way...
translation.ko: 무어 신부님은 그저 다른 방식으로 에밀리를 돕고자 했죠

translation.en: ...using an approach that he, Emily and her family firmly believed...
translation.ko: 그와 에밀리 그리고 가족들이 굳게 믿고 있었던 방식으로요

translation.en: ...was her only chance for relief.
And we will show that despite his greatest efforts...
...and his sincere love for Emily...
...there was nothing he could've done to prevent the death of Emily Rose.
translation.ko: 무어 신부는 에밀리의 죽음을 막을 길이 없었던 것입니다

translation.en: Are you okay?
Aren't you gonna eat anything?
She said it was terrible to hear the clinking of spoons and forks.
translation.ko: 숟가락과 포크 부딪치는 소리가 끔찍하게 싫다고 했고

translation.en: She was always hungry, but she said they wouldn't let her eat.
translation.ko: 늘 배가 고픈데 그들이 먹지 못하게 한댔어요

translation.en: Who did she mean by "they"?
The forces that were in control of her.
That were inside her.
You know, the demons.
Tell us what else happened that night.
I walked her back to her dorm...
...and she seemed really nervous and scared.
So I held her for a while, trying to calm her down.
translation.ko: 그래서 잠깐 같이 있었어요 좀 진정시켜 주려고요

translation.en: I fell asleep, but when I woke up, she wasn't beside me.
translation.ko: 잠이 들었다가 깨어 보니 옆에 없더라고요

translation.en: Emily?
Hey.
Can you hear me?
I called her father, and he told me to bring Emily home.
translation.ko: 에밀리 아버지한테 전화했더니 집으로 데려오라고 하셨어요

translation.en: Jason and I put Emily to bed...
...hoping she would sleep.
And when did Father Moore become involved?
Emily stayed home after that.
She didn't return to school, and she kept getting worse.
translation.ko: 학교로 돌아가지 않았고 상태는 계속 악화했어요

translation.en: Eventually, when she didn't get better, we called our priest, Father Moore.
translation.ko: 결국 나아지지 않아 무어 신부님께 연락했죠

translation.en: When he arrived, I sent my daughter Alice upstairs...
translation.ko: 신부님이 오셨을 때 동생 앨리스에게 올라가서

translation.en: ...to see if Emily was awake.
Emily?
Can I come in?
-Our Father, who art in heaven-- -Emily?
Father Moore is here. Can you come downstairs?
translation.ko: 무어 신부님이 오셨는데 내려갈 수 있겠어?

translation.en: --as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread....
Emily, can you hear me?
Let's get her off the floor.
Alice, no!
I am the one who dwells within.
And I am the one who comes in His name.
translation.ko: 나는 주님의 이름으로 이곳에 온 것이다!

translation.en: Think you can force me out, priest?
translation.ko: 날 쫓아낼 수 있을 것 같나?

translation.en: Try.
I dare you.
You've suffered a terrible loss, Mr. Rose. I know this is difficult.
So thank you for being here today.
Sir, do you often read the Bible?
-Yes, I do. -So do I.
What about the DSM?
The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders...
...commonly referred to as the bible of abnormal psychiatry.
-Have you read that? -No.
So you're not aware that according to the DSM...
...a person's refusal to eat is a common indication of anorexia?
translation.ko: 먹기를 거부하는 것이 거식증의 일반적 징후라는 걸 모르시겠군요

translation.en: Objection. The witness just said he hasn't read the DSM, Your Honor.
translation.ko: 이의 있습니다, 증인은 읽지 않았다고 말했습니다

translation.en: -Sustained. -Mr. Rose...
...are you aware that catatonic rigidity...
...specifically a locking up of the body's joints...
...is a known symptom of psychosis?
translation.ko: 정신병의 한 증상이라는 것을 알고 계시나요?

translation.en: No. I haven't studied these things.
Have you ever visited an insane asylum...
translation.ko: 혹시 정신 병원에 가 보신 적 있나요?

translation.en: ...or a hospital for the mentally ill?
Once. My aunt was in one before she died.
Really? So there's a history of mental illness in your family?
translation.ko: 그래요? 그럼 정신병에 가족력이 있다는 거군요

translation.en: I suppose.
Sir, if you saw someone eating insects...
...on a street corner, would you say that that person is mentally ill?
-Probably, yes. -So can you say with confidence...
...that the behavior you saw in your daughter's bedroom...
...could not be the behavior of someone suffering from psychosis?
translation.ko: 정신병이 있는 사람의 행동이 아닐 수 있다는 것인가요?

translation.en: I don't know. She never had any problems like that before.
It just didn't feel that way to me or to Father Moore.
translation.ko: 그래서 그런 생각이 안 들었고 신부님께서도 그러셨어요

translation.en: -And you trusted him, right? -Yes.
He is our parish priest.
Fair enough. And after that night, would you say that you...
...put your daughter entirely in Father Moore's care?
translation.ko: 따님을 완전히 무어 신부님께 맡기신 건가요?

translation.en: Yes. We had done all we could.
translation.ko: 네, 할 수 있는 건 다 했으니

translation.en: We said she was in his hands now...
...body and soul.
Thank you. No further questions, Your Honor.
Thank you, Mr. Rose. You may step down.
The defense calls Dr. Sadira Adani.
I am currently a professor of anthropology and psychiatry...
translation.ko: 저는 현재 인류학과 정신 의학 교수입니다

translation.en: ...at Northwestern University.
Where did you receive your education?
At Yale, and then at Cambridge.
And what is your specific area of expertise?
I study the spiritual experiences of people in various cultures...
translation.ko: 다양한 문화에 사는 사람들의 영적 체험과

translation.en: ...and the physiological and psychological changes...
...they undergo during these experiences.
translation.ko: 그런 영적 체험 중에 겪게 되는 변화들요

translation.en: Would it be accurate to say that you specialize in the study of possession?
translation.ko: 정확히는 빙의에 관한 과학적 연구를 전문으로 하시는군요?

translation.en: Yes. "Possession" is one term for a basic human experience...
translation.ko: 네, 빙의는 기본적으로 인간이 겪는 경험의 하나로

translation.en: ...reported by a great number of people all around the world.
translation.ko: 전 세계 많은 사람의 사례가 알려져 있습니다

translation.en: In my fieldwork, I've seen many people who experienced...
translation.ko: 현장 조사 중에 제 눈으로 직접

translation.en: ...a sense of being invaded by an entity from the supernatural realm.
translation.ko: 초자연적 힘에 빙의된 이들을 많이 봤고요

translation.en: Why do you think Emily was invaded?
Why did this possession happen to her?
translation.ko: 왜 그런 빙의 현상이 나타났던 것일까요?

translation.en: Based on my study of the case file...
translation.ko: 제가 사건 파일을 검토해 본 바로는

translation.en: ...I believe that Emily Rose was a hypersensitive.
A person with an unusual connection...
...to what Carlos Castaneda called "the separate reality."
translation.ko: 영적인 실체와 남다른 관계를 맺게 되죠

translation.en: Hypersensitives are born different from everyone else.
translation.ko: 극도로 과민한 이들은 선천적으로 남들과 달라요

translation.en: They can have visions of the future, or see the dead...
translation.ko: 미래를 내다보거나 망자들을 볼 수도 있죠

translation.en: ...and sometimes be uniquely susceptible...
...to invasion by an entity that is alien to them.
Objection.
On what grounds?
How about silliness, Your Honor?
A young girl suffered terribly and died.
Do we have to subject her illness to this pseudoscientific analysis?
translation.ko: 그걸 이런 사이비 과학으로 분석하는 게 말이 됩니까?

translation.en: Both counselors, please approach the bench.
Your Honor, this testimony is beyond ridiculous. Visions--
translation.ko: 이런 식의 증언은 정말 말도 안 됩니다

translation.en: Supernatural belief systems are shared by millions of people.
translation.ko: 전 세계 수많은 사람이 초자연적 실제를 믿고 있고

translation.en: We're in The Twilight Zone here.
Her expertise is relevant to the issues in this case.
translation.ko: 저분의 전문 지식은 사건과 직접적 관련이 있어요

translation.en: Let's have a witch doctor sift through bones--
translation.ko: 아예 주술사를 부르고 동물 뼈를 가져다가

translation.en: Stop.
We've heard a great deal of testimony...
...in support of a medical explanation for Emily's condition.
Now we have a witness who has spent her career...
translation.ko: 이제 증인은 피고 측의 대체 주장을

translation.en: ...studying the defense's alternative explanation.
An exorcism expert, if you will.
I think we'll hear what she has to say.
Thank you, Your Honor.
Dr. Adani, why do you think Emily's exorcism failed?
translation.ko: 박사님, 에밀리의 엑소시즘이 왜 실패했다고 생각하시죠?

translation.en: The medical treatment. Specifically, the drug Gambutrol.
Please explain.
The exorcism ritual results in a specific brain activity...
translation.ko: 엑소시즘 의식은 뇌의 특정 부위를 활성화해

translation.en: ...that cuts the person off from the possession experience.
translation.ko: 빙의된 상태에서 벗어나게 해 주는 것입니다

translation.en: But Emily's exorcism could not have achieved this...
translation.ko: 하지만 에밀리의 의식에서는 그럴 수가 없었죠

translation.en: ...because the doctor gave her Gambutrol...
...which has an intoxicating effect on the brain.
The drug made her immune to the psycho-spiritual shock...
translation.ko: 그 약이 정신적 쇼크가 통하지 않게 했던 것입니다

translation.en: ...that exorcism is intended to provide.
What do you believe was the result of treatment with this intoxicating drug?
translation.ko: 그 약물치료로 어떤 결과가 발생할 수 있었을까요?

translation.en: Gambutrol locked Emily in the possessed state.
translation.ko: 감부트롤이 에밀리를 빙의 상태에 가둬 둔 것이죠

translation.en: This left her unable to respond to the exorcism...
translation.ko: 그래서 엑소시즘 의식에 반응할 수 없었고

translation.en: ...and therefore, it directly contributed to her death.
No further questions.
Erin!
I've got a doctor who wants to testify.
He's an eyewitness, Erin.
He was there. He was at the exorcism.
-What? -He called us.
Dr. Graham Cartwright, Department of Abnormal Psychiatry...
...at St. Mary's Hospital.
Dr. Cartwright. Ring a bell?
Yes.
He was there?
-Yes. -Father...
...if you want me to defend you, you've got to give me...
translation.ko: 제가 변호하기를 원하시면 정보를 주셔야 해요

translation.en: ...all the information I need.
With all of this medical testimony helping the prosecution...
translation.ko: 모든 의학적 증언들이 검사 측에 유리한 상황인데

translation.en: ...how could you not tell me that a doctor attended the exorcism?
translation.ko: 어떻게 그분이 함께했다는 말을 안 하실 수 있죠?

translation.en: He asked that I keep his involvement confidential...
...and I said I would.
Dr. Cartwright?
I recognize you from those courtroom drawings on the news.
You're much prettier in real life.
-May I sit? -Yes, please.
You're losing.
I had hoped Father Moore wouldn't need me...
translation.ko: 무어 신부에게 내가 필요하지 않기를 바랐는데

translation.en: ...but I don't wanna see him put away.
translation.ko: 그가 감옥에 가는 건 원치 않아요

translation.en: How do you know him?
Well, I was his parishioner at St. Vincent's Church...
...about 15 years ago.
I hadn't seen or heard of him for years when he called me last fall.
translation.ko: 한동안 소식 없이 지냈는데 작년 가을에 전화가 왔어요

translation.en: But he needed help, so....
What kind of help, doctor?
He wanted a medical perspective from a psychiatrist...
translation.ko: 의학적 소견을 가진 정신과 의사의 참관을 원했어요

translation.en: ...you know, one that he knew, trusted...
...to observe Emily's physical and mental state during this....
translation.ko: 에밀리의 육체적, 정신적 상태를 관찰해 주기를 원했죠

translation.en: During the exorcism.
Yeah.
Doctor.
Doctor.
Can you help our case?
That girl was not schizophrenic...
...and she was not epileptic, or any combination of the two.
I've seen hundreds of people with those problems.
They can be terrible afflictions, of course, but they don't scare me.
translation.ko: 끔찍한 고통을 겪기는 했지만 겁이 나지는 않았어요

translation.en: But what you saw that night in Emily, that did scare you.
translation.ko: 하지만 그날 밤 에밀리를 보고 겁이 나셨군요

translation.en: God, if I'd known, I never would've been there.
I started praying again since then, you know.
I examined that girl before I drove back to the city that night.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 돌아가기 전에 그 애를 진찰했는데

translation.en: She was lucid...
...and she was completely aware of this separate entity inside her.
translation.ko: 자기 안에 분리된 실체를 분명히 알아차리고 있었고

translation.en: When she wasn't in his grip, she was totally herself, completely normal.
translation.ko: 그 손아귀에서 벗어났을 때는 그야말로 완전히 정상이었죠

translation.en: The awareness of her alternate mental state is counterindicative of psychosis.
translation.ko: 그런 상태를 인지하는 것은 정신병과는 거리가 멀어요

translation.en: Crazy people don't know they're crazy.
translation.ko: 미친 사람은 자신이 미친 걸 모른다는 말씀이죠?

translation.en: That's right.
You'll testify to all of this, in detail?
Everything you saw?
Send me the case files and tell me when to be in court.
translation.ko: 사건 파일 보내고 출석 날짜를 알려줘요

translation.en: Thank you, doctor.
We need this.
Before he was arrested, Father Moore sent this to me.
translation.ko: 체포되기 전에 무어 신부가 나한테 이걸 보냈어요

translation.en: He asked me to take care of it.
It's your burden now.
One more thing. When you saw Emily...
...did Father Moore ask you to give her any medical help?
He was already trying to stop her from injuring herself and urging her to eat.
translation.ko: 이미 그 애가 자해하는 걸 막고 뭔가 먹이려 애쓰고 있었어요

translation.en: And I told him, as a doctor, I couldn't help her.
translation.ko: 난 의사로서 그 애를 도울 수 없다고 했소

translation.en: Dr. Cartwright's going to testify.
Don't you get it?
He's not just an eyewitness to the exorcism.
He can also refute the prosecution's medical case. This is huge for us.
translation.ko: 검사 측 주장을 반박할 수 있는 아주 대단한 분이라고요

translation.en: When do I get to testify?
I don't know. Let's take this one step at a time.
No.
What matters most is Emily's story, which only I can tell.
translation.ko: 가장 중요한 건 나만 할 수 있는 에밀리에 관한 이야기예요

translation.en: I understand.
Have you thought about what I said before?
translation.ko: 전에 내가 했던 말 생각해 봤어요?

translation.en: About dark forces and demonic attacks?
Yes, I have.
That day, after Briggs testified...
...I was feeling awful.
And I went out for a walk just to clear my head...
...and I was thinking about what you said to me. Thinking:
"What if demons really do exist?"
And wondering what that would mean if I believed that.
translation.ko: 그걸 믿는다는 게 어떤 의미가 있을까?

translation.en: Because God knows, I have my own demons.
translation.ko: 내 안에 악령이 있대도 그걸 누가 알겠어요?

translation.en: And I saw something lying on the sidewalk.
It was a gold locket...
...with the initials E.C.B. engraved on it.
translation.ko: 그 안에 ECB라는 이니셜이 새겨져 있었어요

translation.en: My middle name is Christine.
Erin Christine Bruner.
And of all the people walking by that day, I found that locket.
translation.ko: 수많은 이들이 지나갔을 곳에서 그걸 제가 발견했던 거예요

translation.en: What are the chances of that?
I don't know, maybe it was a sign.
Or maybe it was just some incredible coincidence.
translation.ko: 그저 믿기 힘든 우연일 수도 있지만

translation.en: But it made me feel...
...like no matter what mistakes I've made in the past...
translation.ko: 제가 과거에 어떤 실수를 했다 하더라도

translation.en: ...at that moment, I was exactly where I was meant to be.
translation.ko: 그 순간에는 정말 있어야 할 자리에 있었다고 느꼈어요

translation.en: Like I was on the right path.
You sound more like a mystic than an agnostic.
Are you wearing the locket now?
No.
You should.
The archdiocese doesn't want you to testify.
translation.ko: 대교구가 신부님이 증언하는 것을 원치 않아요

translation.en: They're just afraid that I'll embarrass them.
Testify to some medieval-sounding supernatural nonsense.
translation.ko: 중세에나 지껄일 초자연적 현상 어쩌고 허튼소리나 할까 싶어서

translation.en: They're expecting me to talk you out of it.
I've just decided I'm not even gonna try.
Why not?
If the archdiocese wants to avoid embarrassment...
...they need you to walk out of here a free man.
I believe a jury will find you sincere and credible...
...and when Dr. Cartwright corroborates your testimony...
translation.ko: 카트라이트 박사님이 증언에 신빙성을 더해 주시면

translation.en: ...and refutes the prosecution's medical arguments...
translation.ko: 검사 측의 의학적 주장을 반박할 수 있어

translation.en: ...we'll get an acquittal.
And everyone will thank me for it.
Emily!
God help me.
Do you swear to tell the truth, the whole truth, so help you God?
I do.
Father Moore, before you could perform the exorcism...
...you had to get the sanction of the Church, correct?
Yes, on October the 27th of last year...
...I presented my assessment and recommendation to the archbishop...
...and he authorized the exorcism that day before I left his office.
translation.ko: 그날 그의 사무실을 나서기 전에 엑소시즘을 허가해 줬습니다

translation.en: Tell us what happened that night.
I drove home.
I sat up till after midnight studying The Roman Ritual...
translation.ko: 자정 넘어까지 로마 의식에 관해 공부했습니다

translation.en: ...thinking about what lay ahead.
You mean The Roman Ritual of Exorcism.
A text used by Catholic priests...
...as a guide to performing the exorcism rite.
Yes, I think I actually fell asleep with the book in my hand.
translation.ko: 네, 그 책을 든 채로 잠들었던 것 같습니다

translation.en: What happened next?
I woke up, freezing.
It was exactly 3 a.m.
Three a.m. is the demonic witching hour.
It's a way for demons to mock the Holy Trinity.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 성 삼위일체를 조롱하는 것이죠

translation.en: It's an inversion of 3 p.m., the miracle hour...
...which is traditionally accepted as the hour of Christ's death.
translation.ko: 전통적으로 예수가 돌아가신 시간으로 여겨지기도 합니다

translation.en: I thought I smelled something burning.
translation.ko: 뭔가 타는 냄새가 나는 것 같았어요

translation.en: Only later did I connect it...
...and I remembered that that same smell of something burning...
...had been perceived by Emily.
Holy Mary, mother of God, pray for us sinners, now and--
translation.ko: 성모 마리아여 저희 죄인을 위해 기도해 주시고

translation.en: Pray for us sinners, now and at the hour of our--
At the hour of--
What do you make of this gesture, this nod in your direction?
translation.ko: 왜 신부님을 향해 끄덕이는 그런 제스처를 했을까요?

translation.en: I don't know. Some kind of acknowledgment, I guess.
That the game is on.
You're really God's gunslinger, aren't you, Father?
Standing tall and facing the devil with your prayer book at your side.
translation.ko: 손에 기도서를 들고 악령에 당당히 맞서라

translation.en: Objection, Your Honor. Counsel's harassing my witness.
Sustained. Mr. Thomas, you know I won't allow that in my courtroom.
translation.ko: 인정합니다, 내 법정에서는 그런 행동 용납 못 합니다

translation.en: Forgive me, Your Honor.
Father, did you understand this black-robed figure to be the devil?
translation.ko: 그 검은 옷의 형체를 악령이라고 생각하셨나요?

translation.en: I believe it was a demonic manifestation.
Like the demonic force you believe possessed Emily?
-Yes. -Why do you think it appeared to you?
I believe the demonic can appear as an apparition...
...much like a ghost, in an attempt to excite our fear.
translation.ko: 유령과 거의 흡사하지만 인간의 두려움을 자극하죠

translation.en: -Did it excite your fear, Father? -It scared the hell out of me.
So this night, when you began to prepare Emily's exorcism...
translation.ko: 그럼 에밀리에게 엑소시즘을 시작하려고 했던 그 날

translation.en: ...was it your first encounter with this demon ghost?
-Yes. -Have you seen it again?
I've seen it ever since.
No further questions at this time.
Redirect, Your Honor.
Father Moore, after you received the bishop's authorization...
translation.ko: 무어 신부님 주교의 허가를 받고 나서

translation.en: ...when did you proceed with an exorcism?
October 31st.
On Halloween. Isn't that a bit dramatic?
Halloween tradition is based on legends throughout history...
translation.ko: 핼러윈 전통은 역사적 전설에 근거한 것인데

translation.en: ...that indicate a real increase in spiritual activity on that night...
translation.ko: 그날 밤 실제로 영적 세력이 아주 활성화되어

translation.en: ...and I thought we could use the occasion to draw them into the open.
translation.ko: 그 기회를 이용해 끌어낼 수 있겠다 싶었습니다

translation.en: -The demons, you mean? -Yes.
Father Moore...
...can you identify this?
It's my tape recorder. I used it to record the exorcism.
translation.ko: 제 녹음기입니다 엑소시즘 의식을 녹음한 것요

translation.en: Inside is the tape I made that night.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 녹음한 테이프가 들어 있습니다

translation.en: Why would you make such a tape?
Ever since the technology has been available...
...exorcists have used tape recorders to authenticate the ritual...
translation.ko: 테이프에 녹음한 것은 그 의식이 실제임을 입증하고

translation.en: ...and provide a record for review.
I offer into evidence this cassette recorder and audiotape....
translation.ko: 이 녹음기와 테이프를 증거로 제출하고자 합니다

translation.en: Objection. The people were not aware of the existence of this tape...
translation.ko: 이의 있습니다! 이 테이프의 존재는 전혀 알지 못했습니다

translation.en: -...until last night. -Neither were we.
This tape is new evidence that came into our possession yesterday.
We provided counsel for the people with a transcript of its contents.
You mean this tape was not given to you by your client?
translation.ko: 그럼 피고한테 받은 것이 아니라는 말이군요

translation.en: No, Your Honor. We received it from a reluctant witness...
translation.ko: 네, 주저해 하던 목격자에게 받은 것인데

translation.en: ...Dr. Graham Cartwright, who will also be called to testify to its authenticity.
translation.ko: 카트라이트 박사가 그 진실을 증언도 해 주기로 하셨습니다

translation.en: The people will find his name on the updated witness list...
translation.ko: 최신 증인 명단에서 그 이름을 보실 수 있고

translation.en: ...we provided to them this morning.
Very well. I'll allow it into evidence.
Father Moore.
Will you play the tape for us now?
This is the exorcism of Emily Rose.
Those present are myself, Father Richard Moore...
...Nathaniel, Emily's father...
...Jason, her friend...
...a doctor who is here to monitor Emily during the ritual...
translation.ko: 의식 중에 에밀리의 상태를 관찰할 의사

translation.en: ...and Emily herself...
...who has given her permission for the ritual to be performed.
All right, now listen.
You may say the rosary or any private prayer for her deliverance...
translation.ko: 에밀리를 위해 묵주 기도나 개인 기도를 하셔도 됩니다

translation.en: ...when you're not responding to my words.
Above all...
...do whatever I ask, without question.
translation.ko: 질문하지 말고 제가 요청하는 대로 하세요

translation.en: Don't ask it any questions...
...or pay any attention to what it says.
translation.ko: 그것이 뭐라고 하든 신경 쓰지 마세요

translation.en: "It"?
We won't be dealing with Emily tonight.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤은 에밀리를 상대하는 것이 아닙니다

translation.en: Restrain her.
Lord Jesus Christ, have mercy on us.
translation.ko: 주 예수 그리스도여 저희에게 자비를 베푸소서

translation.en: It has begun.
Let us pray.
"Because she hopes in you, my God."
"Send her help from the holy place, Lord."
"And give her heavenly protection."
"May the Lord be with you."
"And with your spirit."
Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name.
translation.ko: 하늘에 계신 우리 아버지 아버지의 이름이 거룩히 빛나시며

translation.en: My God. Are you all right?
Dolls and kisses and crosses and wishes...
...you think that can save your little girl?
translation.ko: 그따위로 이 아이를 구할 수 있을 것 같나?

translation.en: Thy kingdom come, thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.
translation.ko: 아버지의 뜻이 하늘에서와 같이 땅에서도 이루어지소서

translation.en: I'm fine.
Give us this day our daily bread.
And forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those that trespass against us.
And lead us not into temptation--
But deliver us from evil!
Who are you, demon? Tell me your name.
I am the one who dwells within....
In the Name of Christ...
...identify yourself!
One, two, three, four, five, six. One, two, three, four, five, six.
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷, 다섯, 여섯! 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷, 다섯, 여섯!

translation.en: Trick or treat. I give you treats and tricks.
translation.ko: 맛있는 거 줘 그럼 장난 안 치지

translation.en: One, two, three, four, five, six.
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷, 다섯, 여섯!

translation.en: Father Moore!
Papa!
Emily!
Emily!
She feels so hot, Father! She's burning up!
Hold her down there on the straw! Hold her!
Emily!
Doctor! I need you here now. Watch her vital signs.
translation.ko: 선생님, 도움이 필요해요 바이털 사인 확인해 주세요

translation.en: In the beginning was the word.
And the word was with God.
And the word was the word, and what a wonderful word it was.
Through him all things remain.
Without him, nothing was made that has been made.
And the 70 disciples returned again with joy, saying:
"Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name."
translation.ko: 주여, 주의 이름이면 귀신들도 우리에게 항복하더이다

translation.en: Her heart is racing. It's almost 180 beats a minute.
translation.ko: 심장 박동이 너무 빨리요 거의 분당 180이에요

translation.en: I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.
translation.ko: 사탄이 하늘로부터 번개 같이 떨어지는 것을 내가 보았노라

translation.en: Behold. I give you power to tread on serpents and scorpions...
...and over all the power of the enemy.
translation.ko: 원수의 모든 능력을 제어할 권능을 주었으니

translation.en: And nothing shall, by any means, hurt you.
Nothing...?
Get it off! Get it off! Get it off!
translation.ko: 저리 가! 저리 가! 저리 가!

translation.en: Release him, demon. I command you in the name of our Lord, Jesus Christ.
translation.ko: 그를 놔 줘라, 악령아! 주 예수의 이름으로 명하노라

translation.en: Tell me your name, wicked one.
One, two, three, four, five, six!
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷, 다섯, 여섯!

translation.en: He who commands you is he who ordered you thrown down...
translation.ko: 지금 너에게 명하는 이는 너를 천상의 하늘에서

translation.en: ...from the highest heaven into the depths of hell.
In the name of our Lord, Jesus Christ, I now command you:
translation.ko: 주 예수의 이름으로 이제 너에게 명하노라

translation.en: Give me your name, demon!
Names!
Names!
One, two, three, four, five, six!
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷, 다섯, 여섯!

translation.en: Ancient serpents...
...depart from this servant of God!
Tell me your six names!
We are the ones who dwell within!
I am the one who dwelt within Cain!
I am the one who dwelt within Nero!
I once dwelt within Judas!
And I was with Legion!
I am Belial!
And I am Lucifer...
...the devil in the flesh.
Mr. Rose.
Doctor, help him!
After a few moments, Mr. Rose revived...
...but the exorcism had to be abandoned.
Emily was taken to her room and soon fell into a deep sleep.
translation.ko: 에밀리는 방으로 옮겨졌고 곧 깊이 잠들었어요

translation.en: The whole thing was a complete failure.
Describe her behavior from the night of the failed exorcism...
translation.ko: 엑소시즘이 실패했던 그 날 밤부터 죽는 날까지

translation.en: ...until the time of her death.
Violence towards others and herself.
Sometimes she screamed for hours on end.
She drove her head through windows, tried to bite....
Tried to bite holes in the walls, breaking several more of her teeth...
translation.ko: 벽에 난 구멍을 물어뜯어 이빨이 여러 개 부러졌고요

translation.en: ...as you saw in the postmortem photograph.
-You witnessed this? -Some of it, yes.
translation.ko: - 직접 다 보셨나요? - 네, 어떤 것들은요

translation.en: I tried to visit every day...
...and the family told me the rest.
Did you attempt another exorcism?
I wanted to, but Emily refused.
And without the consent of the possessed...
...the exorcism ritual can't be performed.
Did you encourage her to eat?
Yes, every time I saw her...
...but the few times she tried, it seemed like....
Seemed like she couldn't swallow, or she couldn't keep it down.
What about medical care?
I wanted her to continue. I never said she should quit seeing her doctors.
translation.ko: 계속 치료하기를 원했죠 진료를 중단하라고 한 적 없고요

translation.en: That would be wrong. Medical care is not my field.
translation.ko: 그건 안될 일이죠 치료는 제 영역이 아니니까요

translation.en: But you did suggest she stop taking the drug Gambutrol.
Yes.
After the exorcism, she asked for my counsel.
translation.ko: 엑소시즘 의식 후에 저에게 조언을 구했는데

translation.en: She told me that the drugs had never helped her.
translation.ko: 그 약이 전혀 도움이 안 된다고 했어요

translation.en: After all, she was on Gambutrol during the exorcism...
translation.ko: 결국 엑소시즘 의식 때도 감부트롤을 복용한 상태였는데

translation.en: ...when her so-called symptoms were at their peak.
Ultimately, we both felt that she was beyond medical care...
translation.ko: 결국 둘 다 의학적 치료로는 될 일이 아니라는 것을 알고

translation.en: ...and that she had to see this through to the end...
translation.ko: 이를 끝까지 극복할 수 있다고 판단한 것은

translation.en: ...by faith alone.
The dual voices we just heard on this tape...
...you're certain that they were both coming from Emily at the same time?
translation.ko: 동시에 둘 다 에밀리의 입에서 나온 것이라고 확신하시나요?

translation.en: Yes. Yes, I heard them.
Have you tampered with this tape in any way?
No. No, I have not.
No further questions at this time.
Mr. Thomas.
Father Moore, you consider this tape to be proof of the supernatural?
translation.ko: 이 테이프가 초자연적 현상을 입증하는 증거라고 보시나요?

translation.en: I think it's a record of certain indications...
...that Emily was possessed.
Signs of possession, you may call them.
By "signs of possession," would you mean her speaking in languages...
translation.ko: 그 빙의 현상으로 인해 에밀리가 그 순간

translation.en: ...we might assume she couldn't possibly know?
And the vocalization of two distinct voices simultaneously?
translation.ko: 동시에 서로 다른 두 목소리를 낸다는 것인가요?

translation.en: Yes. Among other signs that I observed and described to the court...
translation.ko: 네, 제가 직접 보고 법정에서 진술한 것으로

translation.en: ...while the tape was playing. Things I saw.
translation.ko: 테이프에서 들린 것을 저는 눈으로 보았지만

translation.en: Things you can't hear on the tape.
translation.ko: 여러분은 다 들을 수 없었을 겁니다

translation.en: We'll just have to take your word, won't we?
translation.ko: 그럼 신부님의 말씀만 믿어야 한다는 거군요

translation.en: -Your Honor. -Mr. Thomas.
I apologize. Father, as Emily's parish priest...
...are you aware that she underwent advanced catechism training?
translation.ko: 에밀리 양이 고급 교리 문답 교육을 받았던 걸 아시나요?

translation.en: Yes. Yes. Her family is very devout.
And in that training, did she study Ancient Greek, Hebrew and Latin?
translation.ko: 그 교육 중에 고대 그리스어와 히브리어, 라틴어도 공부했나요?

translation.en: Yes, I think that's right.
Might have even studied Aramaic, Christ and his disciples' language...
translation.ko: 예수와 그 제자들이 썼던 아람어도 배웠던 것 같은데

translation.en: ...which, according to the transcripts, we also heard on the tape, correct?
translation.ko: 녹취록에 따르면 테이프에서 그 언어도 들렸고요, 맞나요?

translation.en: She spoke Aramaic on the tape. It wasn't part of her training.
translation.ko: 아람어를 하기는 했지만 교육 과정에는 없었던 것입니다

translation.en: But it was offered as an elective at her catechism school.
translation.ko: 하지만 교리 문답 학교에서 선택 과목으로 제공됐을 텐데요

translation.en: I have the school's curriculum here if you'd like to see it.
translation.ko: 여기 교과 과정이 있는데 원하시면 보여드리죠

translation.en: No. I'll accept that she might have been exposed to that language.
translation.ko: 아니요, 그 언어도 접했을 가능성이 있음을 인정합니다

translation.en: And according to her high school records...
...German was the foreign language she studied there, yes?
I don't know. If you say so.
So that covers the strange languages we heard on the tape, correct?
translation.ko: 그럼 테이프에서 들었던 이상한 언어들이 다 언급된 것이죠?

translation.en: Did I miss any?
-No. -Good.
We've already established you're no medical expert.
translation.ko: 이미 본인께서 의학 전문가가 아니라고 하셨는데요

translation.en: You said it's not your field.
But are you aware of the dual sets of vocal cords every human possesses?
translation.ko: 그런데 사람의 성대가 진성대와 가성대 두 개라는 걸 아시나요?

translation.en: -No. -Have you heard of...
...the superior vocal cords, which are higher than the ones we use to speak?
translation.ko: 말할 때 가성대가 진성대보다 더 높은 소리를 낸다는 걸 아시나요?

translation.en: No. So you didn't know that Tibetan monks, for example...
...as part of their religious training, teach themselves...
...to activate both sets of vocal cords at once?
translation.ko: 한 번에 두 개의 성대를 쓰는 방법을 터득한다는 걸 아시나요?

translation.en: No, I didn't know that.
Well, now that you do know, would you think it's possible...
...that Emily, in her psychotic state...
...might have activated both sets of vocal cords...
...so as to achieve the amazing effect we heard captured on your audiotape?
translation.ko: 테이프에 녹음된 놀라운 효과를 만들어내는 것이 가능했을까요?

translation.en: Her state was not psychotic.
Father Moore, you told us that in the exorcism we heard...
...you actually saw, once again, this black-robed figure...
translation.ko: 그 검은 옷의 형체를 또다시 보셨다고 했는데요

translation.en: -...or demonic apparition, am I right? -Yes.
But we couldn't see him when you played the tape, correct?
translation.ko: 하지만 테이프를 듣는 동안 저희는 볼 수 없었고요, 그렇죠?

translation.en: -No, of course not. -Of course not.
So that would be another supernatural aspect of the exorcism...
translation.ko: 그것은 엑소시즘 의식 중에 나타난 또 다른 초자연적인 현상일 텐데

translation.en: -...your tape doesn't prove, correct? -Yes.
Where is your dark figure, Father?
Is he here now? Do I look like your demon ghost?
translation.ko: 지금 여기 있나요? 제가 그 악령으로 보이나요?

translation.en: -Your Honor. -Counselor.
I have nothing further.
Does the defense wish to redirect?
No, Your Honor, but we reserve the right to recall the witness later.
translation.ko: 아닙니다, 추후에 증인을 다시 부르도록 하겠습니다

translation.en: Very well. The witness may step down.
Your Honor, my next witness must have been detained.
If we could take a short recess so I could--
You've made this court wait before, counselor. I'm inclined to--
translation.ko: 이미 한 차례 기다렸던 것으로 아는데요

translation.en: Your Honor, please.
Dr. Cartwright came to us in good conscience...
...as an eyewitness to the exorcism on Father Moore's tape.
He can substantiate all of my client's testimony--
translation.ko: 피고의 모든 증언을 입증해 줄 수 있습니다

translation.en: Your Honor, the defense has already presented its exorcism testimony...
translation.ko: 피고가 이미 엑소시즘에 관해 증언을 했는데

translation.en: ...in dramatic fashion. Do we really have to--?
We have absorbed some extraordinary testimony today.
translation.ko: 오늘 모두들 흔치 않은 기이한 증언을 들었으니

translation.en: I think we'll take some time to consider it.
translation.ko: 생각할 시간이 좀 필요한 것 같습니다

translation.en: Court is adjourned until 9:30 tomorrow morning.
-You can't find him? -I went to meet him, he didn't show.
translation.ko: - 찾을 수 없다니 무슨 말이야? - 만나러 갔는데 안 나오셨어요

translation.en: I called his office, I called his house.
Okay. Go to the hospital, ask around. Somebody's gotta know where he is.
translation.ko: 알겠어, 병원에 가서 물어봐 누군가 알 수도 있으니

translation.en: What the hell happened?
Tell Father Moore I'm sorry.
Tell him I know the demons are real and I admire his courage...
translation.ko: 그 악령이 진짜라는 것을 알고 그것에 맞서서 이야기하는

translation.en: ...for standing and speaking against them.
Tell him I know what they can do.
translation.ko: 나도 이제 그들의 능력을 안다고 전해 줘요

translation.en: -Cartwright's dead. -I heard.
Are you drunk?
-Not yet, but I'm working on it. -Have you seen this?
-What the hell were you thinking? -Karl....
You told me you'd talk him out of testifying.
Instead, you put on a freak show with taped demons...
translation.ko: 그러고는 해괴망측한 쇼로 녹음됐다는 악령을 들먹이고

translation.en: ...and a dead girl speaking in tongues...
...and your client testifies that the archbishop sanctioned the exorcism.
translation.ko: 교단이 엑소시즘을 허가했다고 증언까지 하게 만들었잖아

translation.en: We'll be lucky if the archdiocese isn't named--
translation.ko: 운 좋게 교단이 우리 로펌을 거론하지...

translation.en: I had a doctor who was gonna corroborate.
Besides that, Father Moore's testimony's crucial to his defense.
translation.ko: 또 신부님의 증언이 변호에 중요한 것이라고요

translation.en: Did you forget the archdiocese is paying for this defense?
translation.ko: 돈 내고 변호를 맡긴 건 대교구라는 걸 잊었어?

translation.en: The archdiocese isn't on trial.
I swore an oath to do what's best for my client.
Spare me the law school pieties, Bruner.
You cashed in your conscience at the door.
-People can change. -Like James Van Hopper?
It's not over.
I can put Mr. Rose on the stand...
...to corroborate Father Moore about the exorcism.
translation.ko: 엑소시즘에 관한 무어 신부의 증언을 입증할 거예요

translation.en: And there are the girls. Her sister Alice, she saw part of it.
They all look like superstitious rubes. They've got no credibility.
translation.ko: 다 미신에 빠진 이들로 증언에 신빙성이 없어

translation.en: Thomas will rip them to pieces.
You'll be worse off than you are now, if that's possible.
You're gonna replace me on this case.
You've screwed it up beyond all repair.
But the archdiocese feels that replacing you now...
...would only draw more unnecessary attention to the trial.
translation.ko: 불필요한 관심만 더 끌 뿐이라고 생각하고

translation.en: But just so we're clear, Bruner...
...if you put that priest on the stand again, I will fire you.
translation.ko: 신부를 또 증언대에 세우면 그때는 해고할 거야

translation.en: You've been crying.
-Dr. Cartwright is dead. -What?
He was killed. There was an accident. I'm sorry.
I know he was your friend.
We've lost.
Without his testimony, it's over.
No.
No, no, no, it isn't over. We're telling Emily's story. That's what matters.
translation.ko: 아니, 아니, 그렇지 않아요 중요한 건 에밀리의 이야기예요

translation.en: -It can't be worth all this. -Yes, it is worth it.
translation.ko: - 그게 무슨 소용 있겠어요 - 소용 있고말고요

translation.en: Just let me go back on the stand and tell the rest of the story.
translation.ko: 다시 증언대에 서서 남은 이야기를 하게 해 줘요

translation.en: -I can't do that. -You must!
You must.
Erin, you once said that you felt you were on the right path.
translation.ko: 에린! 옳은 길을 가고 있는 것 같다고 했잖아요

translation.en: Don't stray from that path.
Here, take this.
-What is this? -Just read it.
And then decide what you want to do.
I saw your eyes today in court when I explained the significance of 3 a.m.
translation.ko: 법정에서 새벽 3시의 의미를 설명할 때 당신 눈빛을 봤어요

translation.en: It's not going to stop until Emily's story is told.
translation.ko: 에밀리의 이야기를 하기 전에는 절대 멈추지 않을 거요

translation.en: Are you gonna make a statement?
Do you believe it was the devil?
Is the defense ready to proceed?
Yes, Your Honor. The defense recalls Father Richard Moore.
translation.ko: 네, 무어 신부님을 다시 증인으로 신청합니다

translation.en: The witness is reminded that he is still under oath.
-When did you last see Emily alive? -The night before she died.
translation.ko: - 에밀리를 언제 마지막으로 봤죠? - 죽기 전날 밤이었습니다

translation.en: Her mother, Maria, called me and said that Emily had asked for me.
translation.ko: 엄마, 마리아가 전화해서 에밀리가 절 찾는다고 했어요

translation.en: -Why did she ask to see you? -To give me this.
Did Emily explain to you the letter's significance?
translation.ko: 에밀리가 그 편지의 의미를 설명해 줬나요?

translation.en: Yes. She said she'd written it the morning after the failed exorcism...
translation.ko: 네, 엑소시즘이 실패한 다음 날 아침에 썼고

translation.en: ...and that it was important for me to share.
translation.ko: 저도 편지를 보는 것이 중요하다고 했습니다

translation.en: Father Moore, was Emily a good person?
I believe that one day Emily will be recognized as a saint.
-So she loved God. -Yes. She was very devout.
Father Moore, if Emily loved God...
...if she was so good and so devout, why do you think God...
translation.ko: 그렇게 착하고 독실했다면 왜 하느님께서 이런 일이

translation.en: -...allowed this to happen? -Objection.
What is the relevance of that question?
Father Moore's belief in this matter is crucial...
...in establishing his and Emily's understanding of her condition.
translation.ko: 두 사람이 에밀리의 상태에 관해 생각하는

translation.en: And that mutual understanding is paramount in determining...
translation.ko: 상호 간의 이해가 신부님의 과실 치사 여부를

translation.en: ...whether Father Moore was, in fact, negligent.
I'm going to allow it.
Your Honor, you're not really gonna let someone testify...
...about why God would allow the death of a young girl?
translation.ko: 소녀를 죽음으로 이끌었다는 진술을 하게 하실 건가요?

translation.en: The objection has been overruled.
Again, Father Moore:
Why did God allow Emily to become possessed by demons and then die?
translation.ko: 하느님이 왜 에밀리가 악령에 빙의되어 죽게 하셨을까요?

translation.en: I can let Emily answer that.
"Last night, on Allhallows' Eve...
...Father Moore tried to cast six demons from my body.
translation.ko: 무어 신부님이 내 몸에서 여섯 악령을 쫓아내려 하셨다

translation.en: They refused to go.
After the attempted exorcism...."
I was taken to my room, and I fell into a deep sleep.
translation.ko: 나는 방으로 옮겨져 깊은 잠에 빠졌다

translation.en: I awoke a few hours later, hearing a voice calling out my name.
translation.ko: 몇 시간 후, 내 이름을 부르는 소리에 잠에서 깼다

translation.en: "Again, I heard a voice calling my name.
translation.ko: 또다시 내 이름을 부르는 소리가 들렸다

translation.en: It was the Blessed Holy Mother of God.
And when I looked at her...
...she smiled at me and said:
'Emily, heaven is not blind to your pain.'"
translation.ko: 에밀리, 하느님은 너의 고통을 알고 있단다

translation.en: She said the Virgin Mary spoke to her in the middle of a field?
translation.ko: 들판 한가운데서 성모 마리아가 에밀리에게 말을 했다고요?

translation.en: -Yes. -And do you believe her?
I believe Emily spoke the truth.
Please continue.
"I asked the Blessed Mother, 'Why do I suffer like this?'"
translation.ko: 왜 나에게 이런 고통을 주시느냐고 물었다

translation.en: Why did the demons not leave me tonight?
translation.ko: 왜 악령들이 저에게서 떠나지 않는 건가요?

translation.en: "She said, 'I am sorry, Emily.
The demons are going to stay where they are.'
translation.ko: 악령들은 그 안에 그대로 머물 것이니

translation.en: Then she said, 'You can come with me in peace...
translation.ko: 너의 육체를 버리고 나와 함께 가면

translation.en: ...free of your bodily form...
...or you can choose to continue this.
translation.ko: 아니면 계속 이렇게 살아갈 수도 있단다

translation.en: You will suffer greatly.
But through you, many will come to see that the realm of the spirit is real.
translation.ko: 너를 통해 영적 세계가 실재함을 알게 될 것이다

translation.en: The choice is yours.'"
I choose to stay.
"In the end, good will triumph over evil.
Through my experience...
...people will know that demons are real.
translation.ko: 사람들은 악령이 실재함을 알게 될 것이다

translation.en: People say that God is dead.
But how can they think that...
...if I show them the devil?"
Did you see these wounds on both of Emily's hands and both feet?
Yes. Yes, the wounds lasted for some time.
And did you attach any supernatural significance to these wounds?
translation.ko: 그 상처들에 어떤 초자연적인 의미를 부여하셨나요?

translation.en: I believe they were stigmata.
By that, you mean supernatural injuries...
...that correspond to the crucifixion wounds of Jesus Christ?
translation.ko: 예수의 상처와 같은 초자연적인 것이라는 말씀인가요?

translation.en: Yes.
Stigmata are a sign, a mark indicating one is touched by God.
translation.ko: 성흔은 하느님의 손길이 닿은 표식 같은 것이죠

translation.en: After that night, why do you think Emily refused another exorcism?
translation.ko: 그날 밤 이후 에밀리가 왜 엑소시즘 재시도를 거부했을까요?

translation.en: I believe she'd accepted her fate.
Is there anything else you'd like to say about Emily?
translation.ko: 에밀리에 관해 더 하실 말씀 있나요?

translation.en: No.
The defense rests.
Father Moore attaches divine significance...
...to the wounds on Emily's hands and feet.
Why?
Because he sees them as confirmation of what he wants to believe.
That Emily was a saint, touched by the hand of God.
I'm afraid the truth is far less inspiring.
translation.ko: 하지만 진실은 그렇게 대단한 것이 아닙니다

translation.en: Because the truth is, by the time these miraculous wounds appeared...
translation.ko: 진실은 이런 신비로운 상처들이 나타났을 때

translation.en: ...Emily had already shown a tendency to injure herself...
...and simply did so again on one of the barbed-wire fences...
...surrounding the Rose family farm.
Father Moore's beliefs are based on archaic and irrational superstition.
translation.ko: 무어 신부의 생각은 고대의 불합리한 미신에 근거한 것입니다

translation.en: Emily suffered because she was sick...
...not because she was a saint.
I'm a man of faith. And I am also a man of facts.
translation.ko: 저도 믿음이 있지만 사실을 믿는 사람입니다

translation.en: And in here, facts are what must matter.
translation.ko: 이 자리에서 중요한 것은 바로 사실입니다

translation.en: And these are the facts of this case:
Emily Rose had epilepsy, which caused psychosis.
translation.ko: 에밀리 로즈는 간질이었고 그것이 정신병을 초래하여

translation.en: And, given time, medicine would have cured her.
translation.ko: 시간을 가지고 약물로 치료할 수 있었지만

translation.en: But it didn't. Why? Because Father Richard Moore convinced Emily...
translation.ko: 그러지 못했던 것은 무어 신부가 확신하기를

translation.en: ...that she wasn't ill, that she didn't need medicine.
translation.ko: 에밀리는 아픈 것이 아니고 약이 필요 없다고 했기 때문으로

translation.en: And in the weeks leading up to her death...
translation.ko: 그러다 몇 주 후에 죽음에 이르렀을 때

translation.en: ...when she was clearly in need of medical treatment...
...he failed to have her hospitalized.
So...
...the defense has given us an extraordinary...
...creative explanation for the events that led to this.
translation.ko: 말도 안 되는 창의적인 설명을 늘어놓았습니다

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, don't you believe it.
Because the fact is, it wasn't the devil that did this to Emily Rose.
translation.ko: 사실은 이렇습니다 에밀리를 죽인 것은 악령이 아닌

translation.en: It was the defendant.
Counselor.
Ethan Thomas calls himself a man of faith.
I, on the other hand, am a woman of doubt.
Angels and demons.
God and the devil.
These things either exist, or they do not exist.
Are we all alone in this life?
Or are we not alone?
Either thought is astonishing.
Do I really believe that this tragedy is the work of the devil?
translation.ko: 제가 정말 이 비극이 악마의 짓이라고 믿을까요?

translation.en: To be honest, I don't know.
But I cannot deny that it's possible.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 가능성을 부인할 수는 없죠

translation.en: The prosecution wants you to believe...
...that Emily's psychotic epileptic disorder was a fact...
...because facts leave no room for reasonable doubt.
translation.ko: 사실이란 합리적 의심의 여지가 없는 것이니까요

translation.en: But this trial isn't about facts.
This trial is about possibilities.
Is it a fact that Emily was a hypersensitive...
...as Dr. Adani suggests?
A person who's more likely, by her very nature, to become possessed?
translation.ko: 선천적으로 악령에 빙의될 가능성이 더 큰 사람요?

translation.en: I can't say that, but the question is:
Is it possible?
Is it a fact that Gambutrol anesthetized Emily's brain...
...so that the exorcism ritual was rendered ineffective?
translation.ko: 엑소시즘 의식을 소용없게 만들었다는 게 사실일까요?

translation.en: I can't be sure of that.
But is it possible?
Is it a fact that Emily was beloved by God?
translation.ko: 에밀리가 하느님의 총애를 받았다는 것이 사실일까요?

translation.en: And that after her exorcism, she chose to suffer till the end...
translation.ko: 엑소시즘 의식 후에 고통을 겪기로 선택하여

translation.en: ...so that we might believe in a more magical world?
translation.ko: 우리가 그 불가사의한 세계를 더 믿게 되었나요?

translation.en: A world where the spiritual realm really exists?
I can't say that's a fact.
But ask yourself:
Is it possible?
It's what Emily believed.
It's what Father Moore believed.
And that sincere belief is what determined her choices and his.
translation.ko: 그 참된 믿음으로 두 사람은 그런 선택을 내렸던 것입니다

translation.en: Now, for the most important question:
Is Father Richard Moore guilty...
...beyond a reasonable doubt, of negligent homicide?
translation.ko: 합당한 의심의 여지 없이 과실 치사죄인가 하는 것입니다

translation.en: Did he, in fact, neglect Emily's needs in such a way...
...that her death is now on his hands?
No! That is not a fact.
It is not a fact that Emily was epileptic.
It is not a fact that she was psychotic.
Facts...
...leave no room for possibilities.
The only fact...
...the only thing I know beyond a doubt in this case...
translation.ko: 이 사건에서 의심의 여지 없이 제가 아는 유일한 사실은

translation.en: ...is that Father Moore loved Emily with his whole heart.
translation.ko: 무어 신부님이 진심으로 에밀리를 사랑했다는 것입니다

translation.en: He did everything in his power to help her.
translation.ko: 에밀리를 돕기 위해 있는 힘을 다하셨습니다

translation.en: He has risked his very freedom so we could hear her story.
translation.ko: 위험을 무릅쓰고 저희에게 에밀리의 이야기를 들려주셨죠

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury...
...in my job I sometimes have to defend bad men.
translation.ko: 저는 때로 나쁜 사람들도 변호해야 했습니다

translation.en: Father Richard Moore is not one of them.
Don't send a good man to prison.
I'm not asking that you believe everything that Father Moore believes.
translation.ko: 무어 신부님의 생각을 모두 믿으시라는 것이 아니라

translation.en: I'm simply asking that you believe in Father Moore.
translation.ko: 그저 무어 신부님을 믿어 주시기를 부탁드립니다

translation.en: Madam Foreman, has the jury reached a verdict?
We have, Your Honor.
Please read the verdict out loud.
"In the case of The People v. Father Richard Moore...
...we, the jury, find the defendant...
...guilty of negligent homicide."
The court thanks the jury for its service.
Sentencing for this case will be set for April 3rd.
translation.ko: 이 사건의 형량 선고는 4월 3일에 결정될 것입니다

translation.en: Your Honor, if it pleases the court...
...Father Moore requested at the start of trial...
...that if found guilty, he would be sentenced immediately.
translation.ko: 유죄일 경우 즉각적인 형량 선고를 요청하셨습니다

translation.en: Yes, I recall that.
Does the prosecution have any objection to expedited sentencing?
translation.ko: 원고 측은 즉각적인 형량 선고에 이의 있습니까?

translation.en: Very well.
Father Richard Moore, do you understand this sentence...
-...which has been found against you? -Yes, Your Honor.
translation.ko: - 불리할 수 있다는 걸 아시나요? - 네, 재판장님

translation.en: And do you understand the gravity of this crime?
That you may, under the law, be sentenced to a term of up to 10 years?
translation.ko: 법에 따라 최대 징역 10년까지 구형될 수도 있습니다

translation.en: Yes, I do.
Are there any statements you wish to make...
...before I impose this sentence?
-No, Your Honor. -Very well.
Excuse me, Your Honor...
...but the jury would like to make a recommendation...
translation.ko: 배심원단이 선고에 관해 권고하고 싶은 게 있습니다

translation.en: -...regarding the sentence. -Objection.
Sit down, counselor.
It's only a recommendation, and I would like to hear it.
translation.ko: 그저 권고라고 하니 저는 들어보고 싶습니다

translation.en: We recommend a sentence of time served.
translation.ko: 구금 기간을 선고에 포함할 것을 권고합니다

translation.en: I'll accept that.
You are guilty, Father Moore.
And you are free to go.
-This court is dismissed. -All rise.
Thank you.
Well, you shocked us all.
Everyone at the firm sees this as another victory.
translation.ko: 직원들 모두 이것은 또 다른 승리라는군

translation.en: The archdiocese is pleased.
They feel the trial has raised public interest in the Church.
translation.ko: 재판 덕분에 교회에 대한 관심이 늘었다고

translation.en: Have you seen the news?
There's our priest, leaving the courthouse a free man...
translation.ko: 신부님이 자유의 몸으로 법원을 떠나는 모습 말이야

translation.en: ...right next to you.
Just like James Van Hopper.
All right, I'll say it. I was wrong.
But I'm ready to make it right.
I'm offering you a full partnership in the firm.
Keep it.
Will you be able to return to your parish?
I can't go back.
Not now.
Once you've looked into the darkness...
...I think you carry it with you for the rest of your life.
translation.ko: 그것을 평생 짊어지고 가야 할 거요

translation.en: What about you?
I believe you've seen the darkness too.
translation.ko: 당신도 어둠의 힘을 봤던 것 같은데

translation.en: I don't know.
I'm not sure what I've seen.
-Who chose the epitaph? -I did.
It's from the second chapter of Philippians, verse 12.
Emily recited it to me the night before she died.
translation.ko: 에밀리가 죽기 전날 밤 암송해 줬던 거죠
